Label: timeline
Definition: A directive information entity that specifies the sequence in which a series of events occurred or will occur.

Label: population data
Definition: A data item that is about a population of organisms.

Label: location
Definition: A population data item that is about the geographical location of a population of organisms.

Label: num. participants
Definition: A sample size that is about the count of individual organisms in a population.

Label: criteria for enrollment and recruitment procedures
Definition: an inclusion criterion (rule) is_a *eligibility criterion*  which defines and states a condition which, if met, makes an entity suitable for a given task or participation in a given process. For instance, in a study protocol, inclusion criteria indicate the conditions that prospective subjects MUST meet to be eligible for participation in a study.

Label: demographic data
Definition: A quality which inheres in a population of organisms.

Label: sex(es) studied in cohort
Definition: A population quality concerning the sex or sexes of the population.

Label: gender(s) studied in cohort
Definition: A population quality concerning the gender or genders of the population.

Label: age range
Definition: A population quality concerning the age range of a population.

Label: data collection events
Definition: A planned process that is a part of an investigation in which raw data is collected.

Label: aims and objectives
Definition: A directive information entity that describes an intended process endpoint. When part of a plan specification the concretization is realized in a planned process in which the bearer tries to effect the world so that the process endpoint is achieved.

Label: study design
Definition: A plan specification comprised of protocols (which may specify how and what kinds of data will be gathered) that are executed as part of an investigation and is realized during a study design execution.

Label: storage method
Definition: A storage process for a biosample collected from an organism.

Label: sample size
Definition: A count of the number of biosamples collected for an investigation.

Label: processing method
Definition: A material processing which prepares a biosample for investigation.

Label: availability
Definition: An availability textual entity that is about a substance from an organism (a biosample).

Label: sample type
Definition: Material anatomical entity in a gaseous, liquid, semisolid or solid state; produced by anatomical structures or derived from inhaled and ingested substances that have been modified by anatomical structures as they pass through the body.

Label: blood
Definition: A fluid that is composed of blood plasma and erythrocytes.

Label: fasting or non-fasting
Definition: Blood that is collected from an organism which has been fasting for a given amount of time.

Label: urine
Definition: Excretion that is the output of a kidney

Label: saliva
Definition: A fluid produced in the oral cavity by salivary glands, typically used in predigestion, but also in other functions.

Label: stool
Definition: Portion of semisolid bodily waste discharged through the anus[MW,modified]

Label: genomics
Definition: An assay that investigates the genome or genomes of an individual organism or population of organisms.

Label: Microbiome markers (rRNA, etc)
Definition: A genomic assay that profiles the microorganisms present in a sample.

Label: eQTL (Cis eQTLs and/or Trans eQTLs)
Definition: A genomic assay that identifies genetic loci and candidate genes correlated with phenotypes.

Label: DNA/Genotyping
Definition: An assay which generates data about a genotype from a specimen of genomic DNA. A variety of techniques and instruments can be used to produce information about sequence variation at particular genomic positions.

Label: Sequence variants (CNV, SNP arrays)
Definition: An assay that determines lost or amplified genomic regions of DNA by comparing genomic DNA originating from tissues from the same or different individuals using specific techniques such as CGH, array CGH, SNP genotyping

Label: RNAseq/gene expression
Definition: An transcription profiling assay that determines an RNA sequence by analyzing the transcibed regions of the genome and or to quantitate transcript abundance.

Label: Epigenetics
Definition: An assay that identifies epigenetic modifications including histone modifications, open chromatin, and DNA methylation.

Label: WGS
Definition: A DNA sequencing assay that intends to provide information about the sequence of an entire genome of an organism.

Label: WES
Definition: A DNA sequencing assay that intends to provide information about the sequence of the protein coding components of a genome (exons).

Label: Metagenomics
Definition: A DNA sequencing assay that intends to provide information on the DNA sequences of multiple genomes (a metagenome) from different organisms present in the same input sample.

Label: microbiology
Definition: An assay that identifies the organism species in a specimen.

Label: unique identifiers
Definition: An identifier that is guaranteed to be unique among all identifiers in a particular domain.

Label: consent/accessibility
Definition: A textual entity that documents the consenting process used to enroll patients in a study.

Label: date and time-related information
Definition: Information about a calendar date or timestamp indicating day, month, year and time of an event.

Label: healthcare information
Definition: An information content entity about healthcare that is private or public.

Label: routine clincial visits
Definition: a data item that is about an investigation and is the specified output of a data transformation that has only clinical visit data as input

Label: hospitalizations
Definition: an information content entity that is about a part of a health care encounter that occurs in a hospital facility

Label: physician/practitioner info
Definition: A textual entity that contains contact details for an individual's physician, which may include: name, phone number, address, etc.

Label: physical environment
Definition: environmental system associated with the dwelling used by humans.

Label: exposure to carcinogens
Definition: A information content entity that indicates the exposure of an individual to carcinogens in the workplace or environment.

Label: lifestyle and behaviours
Definition: A clinical history that is about the lifestyle and behaviors of an individual which may impact health outcomes.

Label: tobacco use history
Definition: A lifestyle history that is about the tobacco use or exposure of an individual.

Label: alcohol use history
Definition: A lifestyle history that is about the alcohol consumption of an individual.

Label: sleep history
Definition: A lifestyle history that is about the sleep quality and duration of an individual.

Label: dietary history
Definition: A lifestyle history that is about the diet and nutrition of an individual.

Label: recreational drug history
Definition: A lifestyle history that is about the use of unprescribed and/or non-prescription drugs.

Label: physical activity history
Definition: A lifestyle history that is about the typical physical activity of an individual.

Label: oral health history
Definition: A lifestyle history that is about oral health and hygiene.

Label: non-pharmacological interventions
Definition: A treatment history that is about any non-pharamacological treatments such as surgery or physical therapy.

Label: surgical interventions
Definition: A clinical history that is about surgical operations performed on an individual.

Label: psychological interventions
Definition: A non-pharmacological treatment history that is about psychological treatments such as counselling.

Label: radiological interventions
Definition: A non-pharmacological treatment history that is about use of radiology for treatment of disease, disorder, or symptom.

Label: physical therapy interventions
Definition: A non-pharmacological treatment history that is about physical therapy treatments such as physical rehabilitation.

Label: diagnostic interventions
Definition: A non-pharmacological treatment history that is about diagnostic procedures to determine a condition or disease.

Label: medication
Definition: A clinical history that is about the prescription drugs taken by an individual.

Label: associated disease(s)
Definition: Information that is about the disease treated by a drug prescribed to an individual.

Label: drug response(s)
Definition: A biological process that results from a drug stimulus.

Label: prescription
Definition: A health care prescription specifying the initiation, modification or cessation of a drug administration.

Label: administration
Definition:
A drug administration description that specifies a drug administration prescribed or reported by an healthcare provider.

It specifies:
- The drug product
- The posology

It may also specify a starting drug administration condition

Label: cause of death
Definition: An information content entity indicating the cause of death for a participant in the study.

Label: reproduction
Definition: A clinical history that is about pregnancy, maternity, fertility, menses, and any other reproductive aspect.

Label: social environment
Definition: An immaterial entity that encompasses the domain made up of interactions between the individual's physical environment, social processes, and relationships with other individuals and groups.

Label: family history of disease
Definition: A clinical history that is about any family history of disease.

Label: signs and symptoms
Definition: A process experienced by the patient, which can only be experienced by the patient, that is hypothesized to be clinically relevant.

Label: life stage/time point
Definition: A spatiotemporal region encompassing some part of the life cycle of an organism.

Label: perception of health and quality of life

Category: perception of health and quality of life
Label: perception of health
Definition: A psychological measurement of an individual's subjective perception of health.

Category: perception of health and quality of life
Label: quality of life
Definition: A psychological measurement of an individual's perception of their quality of life.

Category: perception of health and quality of life
Label: functional limitations
Definition: Information that is about an individual's limitations in activities that involve caring for an moving the body.

Category: perception of health and quality of life
Label: use of assistive devices
Definition: Information about an individual's use of assistive devices in performing daily activities.

Label: cognitive and psychological measurements
Definition: A measurement datum of some aspect of human psychology.

Label: cognitive functioning
Definition: A psychological measurement of some aspect of intellectual functions such as memory, problem solving, and comprehension.

Label: ADAS
Definition: A cognitive measurement that is an output of the Alzheimer's Disease Assessment Scale.

Label: MMSE
Definition: A cognitive measurement that is an output of the Mini-Mental State Exam.

Label: personality
Definition: A psychological measurement of a person's individual sets of behaviours, cognitions, and emotional patterns.

Label: psychological distress and emotions
Definition: A biological process that results from neurophysiological changes in response to internal and external events.

Label: diseases
Definition: A disease is a disposition to undergo pathological processes that exists in an organism because of one or more disorders in that organism.

Label: skin and subcutaneous tissue diseases
Definition: A disease involving the integumental system.

Label: musculoskeletal system diseases
Definition: A disease involving the musculoskeletal system.

Label: urinary system diseases
Definition: A disease involving the renal system.

Label: connective tissue diseases
Definition: A disease involving the connective tissue.

Label: digestive system diseases
Definition: A disease or disorder that involves the digestive system.

Label: cancer
Definition: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

Label: cardiovascular diseases
Definition: A disease involving the cardiovascular system.

Label: immune system diseases
Definition: A disorder resulting from an abnormality in the immune system.

Label: nervous system disorders
Definition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder that affects the brain, spinal cord, or peripheral nerves.

Label: mental and behaviour disorders
Definition: A disease that has its basis in the disruption of mental process.

Label: respiratory system diseases
Definition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder that affects the respiratory system. Representative examples include pneumonia, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, pulmonary failure, lung adenoma, lung carcinoma, and tracheal carcinoma.

Label: endocrine system diseases
Definition: A disease involving the endocrine system.

Label: infectious diseases
Definition: A disorder resulting from the presence and activity of a microbial, viral, or parasitic agent. It can be transmitted by direct or indirect contact.

Label: blood-related disorders
Definition: A disease involving the hematopoietic system.

Label: injuries
Definition: Damage inflicted on the body as the direct or indirect result of an external force, with or without disruption of structural continuity.

Label: visual system diseases
Definition: A disease that involves the visual system.

Label: diseases of the ear, nose, and/or throat
Definition: Pathological processes of the ear, the nose, and the throat, also known as the ENT diseases.

Label: poisoning
Definition: A condition or physical state produced by the ingestion, injection, inhalation of or exposure to a deleterious agent.

Label: socio-demographic and economic characteristics
Definition: A quality that inheres in an entire organism or part of an organism.

Label: occupation
Definition: An information content entity that is about an activity that realizes a social role and is often performed for payment.

Label: marital status
Definition: a categorical value specification that is about a human being and specifies whether that human being is joined to another human being in marriage

Label: gender
Definition: An organismal quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's preference towards a range of characteristics pertaining to, and differentiating between, masculinity and femininity.

Label: ethnicity/race
Definition: An organismal quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's identification with a group of other individuals on the basis of presumed similarities such as language or common ancestry.

Label: birthplace
Definition: A geographical location in which an individual was born.

Label: residence
Definition: A geographical location in which an individual currently resides.

Label: education
Definition: An organismal quality inhering in a bearer by virute of the bearer's highest level of formal education completed.

Label: family and household structure
Definition: Information that is about the structure of an individual's family and/or household.

Label: religion
Definition: Information about an individual's association with a religion, denomiation, or sub- or non-denominational religious group.

Label: age/birthdate
Definition: A time quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of how long the bearer has existed.

Label: biological sex
Definition: An organismal quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's ability to undergo sexual reproduction in order to differentiate the individuals or types involved.

Label: summary statistics for additional data from federated sources
Definition: A statistic that summarizes a set of federated data.
